result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Tyler Smith-Larson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua Tyler Smith-Larson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua Tyler Smith-Larson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If the debt is not paid or payment arrangements have not been met, the Clerk of Courts office will refer the amount due to the WDOR for collection action.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Tyler Smith-Larson

defendant.name: Smith-Larson, Joshua Tyler
defendant.address: 8921 Grenadier Ave S, Cottage Grove, MN 55016

records.addlTxt: Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission

01:53 PM Defendant Joshua Tyler Smith-Larson in court.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 21CM156, 21CM157, 22CM12, 22CM13, 21TR647, 21TR649, 21TR650, 21TR651, 21TR652, 21TR653, 21TR1558 and 21TR1559. ADA Walker: guilty to Ct#2 in 21CM156, dismiss Ct#1 and 3. guilty to 21CM157. guilty to Ct#4 w/o enhancer in 22CM13- dismiss Ct#1-3. Dismiss all TR's. Requests costs of $443 in 21CM156 and 21CM157. Costs of $443 and 4 days jail w/time served sentence, and restitution in 22CM13. Court goes over Defendant's rights to have an attorney. 2:02 court recesses. 2:06 court resumes. Defendant wishes to proceed pro se.  COURT ACCEPTS waiver of right to attorney, FINDS DEFENDANT FREELY, VOLUNTARILY AND KNOWINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  Def requests expungement. ADA Walker: not eligible due to age. Def pleas guilty to Ct#2 in 21CM156, Ct#1 in 21CM157, and amended Ct#4 (w/o enhancer) in 22CM13.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEFENDANT FREELY, VOLUNTARILY AND KNOWINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.  Court: guilty to Ct#2 in 21CM156, Ct#1 in 21CM157, and amended Ct#4 (w/o enhancer) in 22CM13. Court dismisses all TR cases,  Ct#1 and Ct#3 in 21CM156, 22CM12 and Ct#1-3 in 22CM13. ADA Walker addresses sentence. Victim addresses court. Def addresses court. Court orders court costs $443 in 21CM156 and  also restitution in which was already paid 21CM157 and court costs of $443 and 4 days jail w/time served in 22CM13. DNA sample w/in 30 days.  18 months to pay.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 2:31
Plea hearing on March 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on February 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.

NO CONTACT WHATSOEVER WITH L.R.T., K.T. or M.W.T.
NO CONTACT WITH 513 SO. WASSON LANE APARTMENTS IN RIVER FALLS WI., MAY PICK UP HIS CHILD/GIRLFRIEND BUT WILL NEED TO WAIT IN THE CAR.
Not to possess any firearms.

3:24 PM Defendant Joshua Tyler Smith-Larson appears from Jail via video, Atty Liesl E. Nelson, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 22CM12 and 22CM13. Victims appears by phone. Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights.  NG to all Counts/Cases. On 22CM12 ADA Walker is requesting a $5,000.00 w/conditions of NC  w/R.M.J. Not to possess firearms, no objection. Court so orders. On 22CM13 $10,000.00 SIBS w/conditions of NC w/L.R.T., K.T., M.W.T. or 513 So. Wasson Lane Apartments & not to possess firearms, Atty Nelson argues.  Victims make statements. Court orders bond as requested. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:42 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
